articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Koreans in Japan
						
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met a delegation of Korean residents in Japan at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.
					 He had conversation in a compatriotic atmosphere with the delegation led by Hong In Hum, chairman of the Central Audit Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan.

articles.title: Radioactive Substances Ceaselessly Found
articles.content:
Radioactive Substances Ceaselessly Found
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Radioactive substances, apparently from the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant of Japan, are being ceaselessly detected in the DPRK. 
					 According to the survey by the radioactivity monitoring stations across the country from April 11 to 17, iodine-131 and cesium-137 were found in the air above Wonsan and Chongjin. Their level in Wonsan was tested to be about 0.103mBq and 0.07mBq per cubic meter respectively and that in Chongjin 0.037mBq and 0.08mBq.  
					
					 Trace amounts of iodine-131 and cesium-137 were detected in the rain that covered almost areas of the country on April 14. 
					
					 The monitoring stations, set up in coastal areas including Chongjin, Hamhung, Wonsan and Haeju, are intensifying the survey into seawater, fish and sea plants since Japan discharged a large amount of contaminated water to the sea.

articles.title: S. Korea Condemned for Kidnapping Fishers
articles.content:
S. Korea Condemned for Kidnapping Fishers
						
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang citizens are voicing indignation at the south Korean puppet regime for having seized a drifting fishing boat and its crew of the DPRK in the West Sea of Korea.
					 Ri So Yong, a 23-year-old student of Pyongyang Central Cooking School, told KCNA that the seizure is not an incident but a planned kidnapping.
					
					 She said the kidnapping, detention and submission work are a grave encroachment upon the rights of the DPRK and its citizens and another wicked provocation against the DPRK.
					
					 The victims, instead of being consoled in their misfortune, even suffered from sexual harassment and abuses, she said. The fact proves once again that the south Korean regime is a group of criminals seeking only confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 Pae Yong Min, a 34-year-old man living in Sosong District, Pyongyang, said that the seizure of the boat was aimed to further aggravate the confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north, scuttle north-south dialogue and obstruct the improvement of relations with the north. 
					
					 The criminal act will never escape from public condemnation, he stressed.

articles.title: Friendly Meeting with Indonesian Embassy Officials Held
articles.content:
Friendly Meeting with Indonesian Embassy Officials Held 
Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting took place on Tuesday to mark the 46th anniversary of the visit to Indonesia by General Secretary Kim Jong Il in company with President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present on invitation at the meeting, held at DPRK-Indonesia Friendship Pyongyang Ryulgok Secondary School, were Ambassador Nasri Gustaman and staff members of the Indonesian embassy here. 
					
					 Vice-Chairman Pak Kyong Il and members of the DPRK-Indonesia Friendship Association and teachers and students of the school were on hand. 
					
					 The participants went round various places of the school after being briefed on its history.
					
					 At the meeting speakers expressed belief that the long-standing relations of friendship between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, too. 
					
					 The participants enjoyed an art performance of students and exchanged conversation with each other.

articles.title: Participants in Meeting of Forerunners Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Participants in Meeting of Forerunners Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- The participants in the meeting of forerunners of the "Lathe No. 26" Model Machine Movement in the era of Songun visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Tuesday to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung.
					 The visitors made deep bows to the President who had devoted his all only to prosperity of the country and happiness of the people until the last moments of his great life.

articles.title: National Sci-Technological Festival to Be Opened
articles.content:
National Sci-Technological Festival to Be Opened
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- The 26th National Scientific and Technological Festival will take place at the Three-Revolution Exhibition here from April 26 to 30.
					 The festival, sponsored by the C.C., the General Federation of Science and Technology of Korea, is to be held in such forms as presentation of papers on scientific and technical achievements, exhibition of products, lecture on science and technology and swap and introduction of new technologies.
					
					 Attending it will be scientists, technicians, workers and officials selected at local sci-technological festivals.

articles.title: First Raft for This Year Starts in Amnok River
articles.content:
First Raft for This Year Starts in Amnok River 
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- The first raft for this year was sent along Amnok River in the DPRK on Tuesday. 
					 Officials and workers of the 121 Forestry Complex had worked hard from the outset of the year to produce lots of timbers. 
					
					 Woodmen at different forestry stations carried out their production assignment ahead of schedule while conveying timbers to lumber yard in time. 
					
					 The Amnokgang Rafting Station provided enough rafting materials and accelerated the repair of barrage and readjustment of waterway, making lots of rafts. 
					
					 Rafters of the station successfully drove the first raft on the day.

articles.title: Flower Festival Mirrors Reverence for Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Flower Festival Mirrors Reverence for Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- The ongoing 13th Kimilsungia festival shows deep reverence of the people for President Kim Il Sung.
					 Conspicuous in the main hall of the venue is a large picture of the President with a broad smile on his face.
					
					 The Ministry of Foreign Affairs presents a large floral basket with hundreds of Kimilsungia pots, while the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea displays an inscription "Eternal President" with the flower.
					
					 The Ponghwa Guidance Bureau portrays a flag with some 200 Kimilsungia pots against the background of a picture of Mt. Paektu.  
					
					 The Sangwon Cement Complex exhibits Kimilsungia flowers along with letters "The President Is the Sun of All People" and the Ministry of State Construction Control displays flowers around a miniature of the President's native home in Mangyongdae.
					
					 Flowers cultivated by individuals are also on show.
					
					 The festival is going on at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition in Pyongyang.

articles.title: International Art Festival Comes to Successful End
articles.content:
International Art Festival Comes to Successful End
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- The 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival took place successfully in Pyongyang in commemoration of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (April 15).
					 The Pyongyang festival has a history of nearly 30 years, with the first held in April Juche 71 (1982).
					
					Over the last three decades the festival has drawn a total of 15,000 artistes from over 1,700 art troupes in more than 150 countries and international organizations. Among them are over 2 400 famous artistes including international and national concours winners.
					
					 The festival is viewed as one of the world's largest art events.
					
					 It includes music, dance and acrobatic performances.

articles.title: Many People Visit Chilgol Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Many People Visit Chilgol Revolutionary Site
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Many people are now visiting the Chilgol Revolutionary Site in Pyongyang on the occasion of the 119th birth anniversary of Kang Pan Sok, an indomitable revolutionary fighter. 
					 The site is associated with ardent patriotism and personality of Kang Pan Sok. 
					
					 It has been visited by more than 27.6 million servicepersons, working people of different strata and school youth and children over the past 56 years. 
					
					 In front of Kang Pan Sok's statue at the site, the visitors looked back on the undying exploits of her who brought up President Kim Il Sung as the sun of the nation and left indelible traces in the early period of the Korean revolution.
					
					 They looked around the historic relics and data, being briefed on the fact that she cultivated her anti-Japanese patriotic spirit, undergoing sufferings of the ruined nation, and devoted her all to the revolutionary struggle. 
					
					 Among the visitors were large number of overseas compatriots and foreigners.

articles.title: Rason Area Draws Many Tourists
articles.content:
Rason Area Draws Many Tourists
						
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- The Rason area in the northern part of the DPRK is abundant in tourist resources.
					 It, with historic relics, cultural facilities and fantastic seascape, draws many local and foreign tourists.
					
					 They enjoy sightseeing, sea bathing and angling in different places of the area.
					
					 The Rason City Tourist Bureau has improved Chujin and Kalumdan bathing beaches and the resort on Pipha Islet to attract more tourists.
					
					 The bureau has the Taedonggang International Travel Agency, a hotel on Pipha Islet and other service establishments.
					
					 It plans to increase investment in the three tourist areas -- an area of historic and cultural interest, Haesanggum-Pipha area and Kalumdan-Uam area.

articles.title: New Compound Feed Additive
articles.content:
New Compound Feed Additive
						
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- The Tudan Duck Farm in Pyongyang has applied a new additive to compound feed to increase meat production.
					 The additive promotes organic acid formation in the intestines of domestic animals and activates their immunocyte.
					
					 It is a mixture of five kinds of lactic acid bacteria, including bacillus and micrococcus, and two kinds of amino acid hay bacilli.
					
					 It, which keeps animals from falling ill even after taking musty feed, is applicable to any kind of assorted feed.

articles.title: Pyongyang Cultural Exhibition
articles.content:
Pyongyang Cultural Exhibition
						
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Cultural Exhibition, located in Munsu Street, is one of the tourist attractions in the capital of the DPRK.
					Highlighted in the main hall of the exhibition is a large picture of President Kim Il Sung being with General Secretary Kim Jong Il on Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The exhibition houses more than 20,000 volumes of over 1,200 books, including famous works of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, literature and albums.
					
					 Among them are books written by foreigners about the great men and books and pictorials translated in eight languages, including Chinese, Russian, French and English.
					
					 Included in the exhibits are photos showing great feats performed by Kim Jong Il last year in guiding the building of a thriving nation and other photos reflecting the Korean people's effort to make signal achievements in production and construction before greeting the 100th birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung next year.
					
					 Fine art pieces about the history, culture and nature of Korea are also on show.
					
					 Curator Ri Phil Bok told KCNA that more than 45,000 foreigners and overseas Koreans visited the exhibition since it was opened in September Juche 87 (1998).

articles.title: Guidelines Provided by Kim Il Sung for National Reunification
articles.content:
Guidelines Provided by Kim Il Sung for National Reunification 
						
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- The Korean people, who greeted the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (April 15), have recollected the great feats he performed for national reunification, the cause of national independence.
					 The U.S. imperialists, after occupying the southern half of Korea by force of arms along with the end of the Second World War, were seeking to put the whole of Korea under their control.
					
					 After the liberation of the country, the south of Korea schemed to have a "separate election" under the patronage of the United States and allegedly under the sponsorship of the United Nations.
					
					 In order to frustrate the scheme, the President convened a joint conference of representatives of political parties and social organizations in north and south Korea and called for launching a nationwide struggle against the anti-reunification forces' moves to keep the country divided.
					
					 Whenever they attempted to perpetuate the division of the country, he took realistic and scientific measures to smash their plot. 
					
					 Thanks to his strong sense of patriotism, moral influence and political savvy, high-level political talks were held between the north and south of Korea in Pyongyang in early May Juche 61 (1972).
					
					 The President, when meeting the head of the south Korean delegation, said that national reunification should be achieved in an independent and peaceful way without the interference of outside forces and on the principle of promoting great national unity.
					
					 Afterwards, the President set forth the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo, the 10-point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation and other proposals for reunifying the country in the spirit of national independence.
					
					The guidelines he provided for the country's reunification have been carried forward successfully by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Remarks over Tour of Mt. Kumgang Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Remarks over Tour of Mt. Kumgang Slammed
						
Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee and the DPRK General Guidance Bureau for the Development of Scenic Spots formally declared that the DPRK would terminate the validity of the agreement on tour of Mt. Kumgang signed with the Hyundai Group of south Korea, which calls for granting it monopoly over the tour, because there is no hope of resuming the tour.
					 In a statement of spokesman and a detailed report, they also announced that the DPRK would take charge of the international tour through the areas of the north side.
					
					 However, the south Korean authorities call for "repeal of this step", asserting that it is "violation of the agreement" and "unacceptable." 
					
					 Rejecting such assertion, Rodong Sinmun in a signed commentary Tuesday says: 
					
					 The conservative authorities of south Korea have neither face nor right to talk about "violation of agreement" and "repeal of step".
					
					 They have persistently hindered the tour of Mt. Kumgang, considering it as a thorn in the flesh.
					
					 Their refusal to resume the tour of Mt. Kumgang is not for safety of tourists, but it is part of the anti-DPRK scheme to stop the tour, regarding it as "financial resources" for somebody.
					
					 For the Korean nation the tour is not a simple sightseeing of mountains and rivers. It was an important work to reconnect the vein and territory of the nation severed by the foreign forces with burning desire for unity and reunification. 
					
					 It is a mistake for the south Korean authorities to think that the DPRK had made efforts to resume the tour for any economic interests. 
					
					 The highest privilege granted so far by the DPRK to the south side over the tour of Mt. Kumgang is incomparable to what the former received from it.
					
					 The DPRK offered the whole of militarily sensitive area for the tour by the south side. Such being the case, the conservative authorities of south Korea talked nonsense that the tour of Mt. Kumgang is "drain on resources" and "financial resources". 
					
					 They bedeviled the north-south relations and checked the tour of Mt. Kumgang, laying an obstacle in the way of national unity, cooperation and reunification. This crime can be redeemed with nothing.

articles.title: Anniversary of April Popular Uprising Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of April Popular Uprising Observed 
						
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Major newspapers of the DPRK Tuesday mark the 51st anniversary of the April Popular Uprising in south Korea. 
					 The uprising was an eruption of the south Korean people's grudge and wrath at the U.S. imperialists and their lackeys, pent up under their colonial rule in 15 years after the liberation of the country. It was a mass anti-U.S. and anti-fascist resistance involving millions of people across south Korea.
					
					 Youth and students and people from all walks of life in south Korea waged the do-or-die resistance in face of the fascist repression and thus toppled the dictatorial regime of Syngman Rhee, a pro-American traitor.
					
					 Through the uprising they dealt a telling blow at the U.S. colonial enslavement policy and proved that any dictatorial forces can be defeated if the patriotic forces go united and wage implacable struggle, Rodong Sinmun says in a bylined article.
					
					 51 years have passed since the uprising, but the desire of the south Korean people for independence, democracy and reunification has not yet been realized, the article says, adding:
					
					 It is a prerequisite for carving out the nation's independent destiny to put an end to the U.S. domination and interference in south Korea.
					
					 The south Korean people should be mindful that the national dignity and sovereignty can be ensured only through the struggle to resolutely smash the political domination and interference and intensified economic and cultural aggression on the part of the U.S.
					
					They should thoroughly oppose and reject the idea of worshipping and kowtowing to the U.S. and dependence on foreign forces.
					
					 They should check and frustrate the treacherous policy of the conservative ruling forces that are running amuck to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen, backed by outside forces.
					
					 When the people from all walks of life in south Korea wage vigorous and stubborn struggle in the spirit of the April 19 uprising, their cherished desire to live in an independent, democratic and reunified, new world free from foreign forces and the treacherous forces will be certainly realized.
					
					 Minju Joson calls upon all the south Korean people to turn out in the fight to terminate the treacherous rule by the conservative group as the forerunners toppled the Syngman Rhee regime through the April 19 uprising.

articles.title: Beninese Political Party Supports Cause of Korean People
articles.content:
Beninese Political Party Supports Cause of Korean People 
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- The Socialist Party of Benin-Baanitee issued a statement on April 11 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Kim Il Sung is the founder of socialist Korea as he liberated the Korean people from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule and built a people's paradise in Korea, the statement said, adding:
					
					 He performed great exploits for the cause of liberation of the oppressed people and the strengthening and development of the world socialist movement.
					
					 We will make every possible effort to boost the friendly relations with the Workers' Party of Korea and fully support the Korean people in the drive to open the gate to a thriving nation under the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Observe DPRK Anniversaries
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Observe DPRK Anniversaries
Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of various countries carried special write-ups to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 The International Daily of Indonesia on April 8 carried in its one whole page photos and articles introducing the DPRK with portraits of the smiling President and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Nigeria's The New Nigerian on March 28 edited an article praising the KPA, which has grown up to be a army strong in idea and faith under the leadership of Kim Jong Il providing ceaseless field inspection of the army, and the DPRK displaying its dignity as an invincible military power.
					
					 India's Public News on April 4 carried an article on the source of the strength of the KPA, which has reliably guaranteed the defence of socialism and building of a thriving nation, winning one victory after another in the showdown with the U.S.
					
					 Nepal's Arpan on April 8 edited an article titled "Invincible Korean People's Army".
					
					  Ilal Amam, organ of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, carried in its April issue an article titled "New Era of Independence" with a photo of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The April issue of Contro Piano, organ of the Struggle for the Peace and Socialism of Italy, conveyed an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il Creditably Carrying Forward the Cause of President Kim Il Sung".

articles.title: DPRK Anniversaries Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Anniversaries Marked in Different Countries
Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries between April 4 and 7 to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung, the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 They included seminars, round-table talks, reading sessions, lectures, photo exhibitions and film shows in Nepal, Myanmar, the Czech Republic and Guinea.
					
					 On display in the venues of exhibitions were photos showing the revolutionary history and exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and the Korean people in the efforts to build a thriving nation.
					
					 Films shown included "Country Shining with Arms of Mt. Paektu".
					
					 The chief of the International Department of the C.C., the Nepal Worker-Peasant Party and the chairman of the Nepal-Korea Friendship Association at a seminar praised Kim Il Sung as the most prominent leader in the 20th century, recalling his revolutionary life.
					
					 They also noted with high appreciation that Kim Jong Il has performed undying feats for the Korean revolution and global independence.
					
					 The chief of the International Department of the Union Solidarity and Development Party, Union of Myanmar said at the round-table talks that the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung enabled the Korean people to liberate the country, win the Fatherland Liberation War and reliably defend socialism despite the imperialists' moves against the DPRK.
					
					 The President's exploits have been successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Il, said the chairman of the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association at a seminar.
					
					 The director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea at a reading session stressed that socialist Korea would prosper forever as it has the great Songun politics and the powerful and revolutionary Korean People's Army.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at an event in Nepal.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Printed in Russia 
Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" was brought out in booklet by the Khabarovsk Territory Publishing House of Russia on April 14.
					 The work, published on August 4, Juche 86 (1997), deals with the undying exploits of Kim Il Sung and formulates the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as three charters for national reunification.
					
					 It also indicates the tasks and ways for achieving national reunification on the basis of the three charters.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised in UK
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised in UK 
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- A joint seminar of British political parties and organizations took place in London on April 9 to commemorate the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					On display at its venue were works of the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and books on their exploits.
					
					 The chairman of the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea said in his key report that socialist Korea is unthinkable without the revolutionary life of Kim Il Sung and his undying exploits. 
					
					 He praised the President as prominent thinker-theoretician and peerlessly great man who fathered the Juche idea, the greatest ever in the history of human thought, and opened a new era of independence and as the sun of mankind enjoying boundless reverence from not only the Korean people but also the world progressives. 
					
					 The general secretary of the C.C., the New Communist Party of Britain in his speech lauded the immortal feats performed by the President for the Korean revolution and global independence. 
					
					 The secretary general of the Coordinating Committee of the British Friends of the DPRK introduced the achievements made in the DPRK in recent years.
					
					 The vice-chairman and international secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of Great Britain (Marxist-Leninist) referred to the feats of the President who built the Workers' Party of Korea into the revolutionary party of Juche, guiding force of the revolution and construction. 
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Rescue Activities by Koreans in Japan Go On
articles.content:
Rescue Activities by Koreans in Japan Go On
						
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Organizations of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) in different parts of Japan have conducted on a full scale the rescue action for compatriots and Japanese who suffered heavy damage from the killer quake and ensuing tsunami.
					Officials of the Osaka Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon went to the quake-hit areas to convey the aid materials of more than 30,000 pieces of about 150 kinds provided by compatriots.
					
					 The headquarters is also conducting a fund-raising campaign to relieve quake-hit compatriots. 
					
					 Chongryon organizations in Kanagawa, Kawasaki, Yokohama and other areas offered on several installments aid materials and vehicles needed for rehabilitation to the compatriots in Miyagi Prefecture. 
					
					 Involved in the drive to provide aid materials were officials of the Togatsu Branch of Chongryon, the commercial association and the youth league and other compatriots in Chiba Prefecture and representatives of the Saitama Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon and the youth commercial association, the youth league and different branches of Chongryon in the prefecture. 
					
					 Chongryon's rescue teams active in different areas went to the quake-hit areas with relief materials to encourage the compatriots. 
					
					 Officials of the Fukushima prefectural headquarters under the Chongryon central emergency measure committee have concentrated all efforts on rescue operation on the spot. 
					
					 Just after the quake occurred they have worked hard to confirm whereabouts of compatriots and relieve the compatriots and Japanese who took refuge in Fukushima Korean Primary and Middle School. 
					
					 Officials of the Miyagi Prefectural Headquarters of Chongryon gave out the relief materials, provided by Chongryon organizations in different parts, to compatriots in the quake-hit areas. Some of the materials were also sent to places of refuge including Japanese school and indoor stadium.

articles.title: Military Parade and Demo Held in Cuba
articles.content:
Military Parade and Demo Held in Cuba 
 Havana, April 17 (KCNA) -- A military parade and a mass demonstration took place in Cuba on April 16 to mark the 50th anniversary of the proclamation of the Socialist Character of the Revolution and the Playa Giron Victory. 
					 Present there were Raul Castro, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, and senior party and state officials and people from all walks of life. 
					
					 Columns of all services and arms and subunits of the revolutionary armed forces and columns of military academies at all levels marched through. And different kinds of armors, multiple launch rockets, SPGs and missiles passed the plaza and fighters and military copters flied. 
					
					 There was mass demonstration after the military parade.

articles.title: Gambia Asks US to Prosecute Florida Pastor for Burning Koran
articles.content:
Gambia Asks US to Prosecute Florida Pastor for Burning Koran
						
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- The Gambian government in a statement on April 14 urged the U.S. to prosecute Florida pastor for burning a copy of the Holy Koran.
					 The statement denounced the act, committed by Terry Jones, pastor of the U.S. Christian Church in Florida State, in March, as heinous, bigotry and provocative.
					
					 "Terry Jones has carried out his threat which is a declaration of War on Islam and Muslims, thereby endangering world peace and security," it said.
					
					 The statement urged the U.S. government to bring Terry Jones to justice as quickly as possible.

articles.title: Pakistan Protests US Drone Strikes
articles.content:
Pakistan Protests US Drone Strikes
						
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Pakistan has lodged a protest with the American ambassador in Islamabad over two strikes by U.S. pilotless aircraft in South Waziristan tribal region on April 13 which killed at least 6 people, the Foreign Ministry said.
					 "We have repeatedly said that such attacks are counter productive and only contribute to strengthening the hands of the terrorists," it said.

articles.title: Iranian President Raps Big Powers' Moves
articles.content:
Iranian President Raps Big Powers' Moves
						
 Tehran, April 17 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, addressing a recent meeting, strongly denounced the arrogant powers' plots.
					 The U.S. and other Western countries are seeking to sow discord between Arabic countries and Iran and among Islamic factions to give rise to disputes, he said.
					
					 He called upon regional countries to heighten vigilance against such plots of the enemies.

articles.title: Volcano Erupts in Kamchatka of Russia
articles.content:
Volcano Erupts in Kamchatka of Russia
						
 Moscow, April 17 (KCNA) -- The Bezimanii Volcano erupted in Kamchatka, Russia on April 14.
					 Volcano ashes rose as high as up 8-10 km above the sea level.

articles.title: Earthquake Jolts Nicaragua
articles.content:
Earthquake Jolts Nicaragua
						
 Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- A 5.9 magnitude earthquake jolted the western coastal area of Nicaragua on April 15.
					 Its epicenter was waters off the area.

articles.title: Siguen detectando sustancias radiactivas en la RPDC
articles.content:
Siguen detectando sustancias radiactivas en la RPDC
Pyongyang, 19 de abril (ATCC) -- En Corea siguen detectándose las sustancias radiactivas emitidas a la atmósfera en el accidente de la planta nuclear de Fukushima de Japón.
					Según los datos acumulados entre los días 11 y 17 por los observatorios de radiactividad en el medioambiente, instalados por doquier de Corea, el yodo 131 y el cesio 137 se detectaron en 0.103mBq/m3 y 0.07mBq/m3 en Wonsan y en 0.037mBq/m3 y 0.08mBq/m3 en Chongjin, respectivamente.
					
					Se confirmó el hallazgo de una mínima cantidad de las mismas sustancias en las lluvias que cayeron el día 14 en todo el territorio nacional.
					
					Alarmados por los desechos radiactivos echados al mar por Japón, los observatorios instalados en zonas litorales como Chongjin, Hamhung, Wonsan, Haeju, etc. profundizan la medición de las aguas saladas, los peces y algas que crecen en ellas.

articles.title: Capitalinos condenan secuestro cometido por autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Capitalinos condenan secuestro cometido por autoridades surcoreanas
						
Pyongyang, 19 de abril (ATCC) -- Los capitalinos se montan en cólera ante la conducta de la camarilla de títeres surcoreanos que cometió vejaciones inhumanitarias de todo tipo contra los norcoreanos secuestrados con su barco al darse a la deriva en el Mar Oeste de Corea.
					  Consultada por la ATCC, la alumna de la Escuela Central de Cocineros, Ri So Yong (de 23 años de edad), calificó ese incidente de piratería y asalto planeados premeditadamente con todos los detalles, y prosiguió:
					
					  Al secuestrar, retener y "someter" por la fuerza a los norcoreanos que sufrieron accidente, los títeres surcoreanos cometieron un grave e imperdonable atentado contra la soberanía de la República Popular Democrática de Corea y los derechos de sus ciudadanos y otra provocación del mismo carácter. 
					
					Lejos de consolar a los compatriotas siniestrados, ellos no vacilaron en chantajearlos sexualmente e humillarlos. 
					
					  El presente caso volvió a evidenciar que ellos son una banda de salvajes capaces de cualquier crimen de lesa humanidad en función de su campaña de enfrentamiento y conspiración. 
					
					Pae Yong Min (de 34 años de edad), habitante del municipio de Sosong, reveló que el objetivo del acto provocativo de la banda de títeres surcoreanos descansa en agravar la confrontación fratricida, llevar al fracaso el diálogo Norte-Sur y congelar el ambiente a favor de la mejora de relaciones íntercoreanas. 
					
					  Sus actos criminales no se permitirán nunca y serán condenados por todos los compatriotas y en el extranjero, concluyó.

articles.title: Tendrá lugar XXVI Festival Nacional de Ciencias y Técnicas
articles.content:
Tendrá lugar XXVI Festival Nacional de Ciencias y Técnicas
						
Pyongyang, 19 de abril (ATCC) -- Tendrá lugar del día 26 al 30 en la capitalina Exposición Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones el XXVI Festival Nacional de Ciencias y Técnicas bajo el auspicio del Comité Central de la Federación General de Ciencias y Técnicas de Corea.
					Este evento se realizará por diferentes formas como el encuentro de publicación de éxitos científico-técnicos, la exhibición de productos, la lección sobre ciencia y técnica, el intercambio y la guía de nuevas técnicas.
					
					Participarán en el certamen los científicos, técnicos, trabajadores y funcionarios, evaluados altamente en los mismos festivales locales.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica posición del Sur de Corea sobre el turismo
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica posición del Sur de Corea sobre el turismo 
						
Pyongyang, 19 de abril (ATCC) -- Hace poco, el Comité Coreano por la Paz de Asia y el Pacífico (CCPAP) y la Dirección de Desarrollo Integral de Lugares Famosos hicieron pública la declaración del portavoz y la información detallada, respectivamente, en las cuales proclamaron oficialmente que dado que no hay ninguna posibilidad de que se reanude el turismo al monte Kumgang, nuestra parte anularía el monopolio del turismo concedido al Grupo Hyundai del Sur de Corea y se encargaría por sí misma del turismo internacional por vía Norte. 
					Recuerda el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este martes y prosigue:
					
					Ahora las autoridades surcoreanas hablan de la "retirada de estas medidas" calificándolas de "no aceptables" y de una "violación del acuerdo". 
					
					Las autoridades conservadoras surcoreanas no tienen derecho a hablar así, porque siempre pusieron obstáculos en el turismo al monte Kumgang considerándolo como una espina en sus ojos. 
					
					La parte surcoreana elude el turismo no por la preocupación de la seguridad personal de los turistas, sino con el fin de bloquear la llamada "fuente de ingreso" de alguien.
					
					Para la nación coreana el turismo al monte Kumgang no es una simple visita, sino es un trabajo importante para reanudar con el fervor de la unidad y reunificación el linaje consanguíneo y el terreno cortado por las fuerzas extranjeras. 
					
					Es una gran equivocación pensar que la parte Norte se esforzara por la reanudación del turismo al monte Kumgang para obtener la ganancia económica. 
					
					En cuanto al turismo, hemos dado al Sur de Corea las prerrogativas incomparables con los beneficios recibidos. En particular, le concedimos hasta la zona muy delicada en lo militar. 
					
					Las autoridades conservadoras surcoreanas no pueden compensar con nada sus crímenes de haber obstaculizado la unidad, la cooperación y la reunificación de la nación, llevando al fracaso las relaciones íntercoreanas e impidiendo el turismo al monte Kumgang.
